Info.Description: Commonly used to highlight the fine details in an image or to prepare an image for sharpness editing. It works by allowing high-frequency content (smaller details) to pass through while blocking low-frequency content (larger, smooth areas).

Properties.Name: Radius
Properties.Summary: Adjusts the size of the details that the filter targets. A smaller radius will emphasize finer details, while a larger radius will bring out larger details or edges.

Properties.Name: Monochrome
Properties.Summary: Applies the High Pass filter only to the luminance of the image, resulting in a grayscale output that highlights the details in the image. If disabled, the filter is applied to each color channel, preserving the original colors while still emphasizing details.
